Celtic Tattoos - Celtic types are an unbelievably well-known alternative these days for people seeking to get tattooed. A normal rule of thumb is: the form of the pattern generally determines the "meaning" of a knotwork layout. Circles signify unity or eternity, spirals reincarnation or cycles of life and rebirth, triangles and trefoils the threefold dominion of earth, sea, and sky. Squares or 4-fold styles are shield knots, symbols of protection from spirits or evil influences. Interlaced animals and guys commonly represent relationships, or emphasize the interdependence of mankind and nature. There are basically quite very few data of the Celts on their own, and most symbols are interpreted by archaeologists and other scholars who have studied the symbols in context. Some historic Celtic symbols have changed in meaning through time, getting been influenced by the introduction of the Church and the affect of other cultures.
